column2: MINNESOTA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: MN

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column6: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only
column8: Not enter
column10: Stay on the main highway if possible

column2: 2. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column6: Weaving between lanes.
column8: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column6: Truck stop ahead
column8: Trucks under 12,000 lbs. allowed

column2: 4. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column6: Destination signs (guide signs)
column8: Warning signs

column2: 5. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
column6: Steering ability.
column8: Reaction distance.

column2: 6. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column6: the road is narrower ahead.
column8: you must turn right.

column2: 7. A flashing red light:
column4: means the same thing as a stop sign.
column6: is used at dangerous intersections.
column8: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.

column2: 8. Aggressive drivers:
column6: run stop signs.
column8: tailgate other vehicles and make improper lane changes.

column2: 9. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column6: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column8: look at your interior rear-view mirror.

column2: 10. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column6: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.
column8: Yes, except for school zones.

column2: 11. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column6: go the wrong way.
column8: exceed the speed limit

column2: 12. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column6: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 13. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: indicates that you should drive with caution.
column6: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.
column8: has the same meaning as a stop sign.
column10: has the same meaning as a yield sign.

column2: 14. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column6: honk to let them know you’re there.
column8: speed up to pass.

column2: 15. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column6: have no driving errors.
column8: must yield the right-of-way.
column10: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.

column2: 16. When passing another vehicle, before turning back into the right-hand lane drivers should wait until they can see the vehicle they are passing in the rearview mirror.
column6: False

column2: 17. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column6: slow down and keep well to the right.
column8: not turn right.
column10: slow down and keep well to the left.

column2: 18. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column6: sound the horn.
column8: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 19. Never make a U-turn from:
column6: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.
column8: the left lane.

column2: 20. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column6: red warning lights.
column8: green lights.

column2: 21. Before turning, you should:
column4: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.
column6: give the proper turn signal.
column8: increase your speed.

column2: 22. Warning signs normally are:
column6: rectangles.
column8: octagons.

column2: 23. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: always sound their horn and stay alert.
column6: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column8: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column6: Yield to motorcyles, but not to bicycles
column8: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column10: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles

column2: 25. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column6: The car approaching from the right.
column8: The car that is traveling faster.
column10: The car approaching from the left.

column2: 26. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column6: brown and white.
column8: green and white.

column2: 27. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column8: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.

column2: 28. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column6: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.
column8: you cannot pass.

column2: 29. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column6: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column8: Return gestures and shouts.

column2: 30. This sign means:
column6: Reversible lane ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 31. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the speed limit on that route.
column6: the type of route you are on.
column8: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column10: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.

column2: 32. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column8: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.

column2: 33. This sign means:
column6: One-way street
column8: No Passing Zone

column2: 34. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column6: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column8: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 35. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column6: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column8: all vehicles must turn left immediately.

column2: 36. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.
column8: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.

column2: 37. The yield sign means:
column4: The traffic light will soon be red.
column6: You must come to a complete stop.
column8: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column10: Drive with caution in wet weather.

column2: 38. Regulation signs normally are:
column6: blue rectangles.
column8: green rectangles.

column2: 39. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: go to the next entrance ramp.

column2: 40. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column6: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column8: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.
